danger_zone

Class CommandParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • danger_zone.CommandParser

  • public class CommandParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    2012-10-7 The CommandParser is a static class that contains the constants CMD_LON and CMD_LAT which correspond to the format of the geo command to be interpreted. GEO FORMAT: LON XXX.XXXXXX LAT XXX.XXXXXXX where X's are numeric and to any precision. GEO FORMAT: LON XXX.XXXXXX LAT XXX.XXXXXXX NUM XXX where NUM specifies up to how many nodes you would like returned. KILL CODE: KILLSERVER0x0000 CLASSIFY TEXT Classifier will classify the text and return which category it is in, D or S for danger or safe. TRAIN [D|S] TEXT classify given text as dangerous or safe, D will specify the text as Dangerouns and S as Safe. ADD DANGERZONE

      (package private) static java.lang.String OPT_DANGER
      Constant for the classify option ADD to have texted be add as dangerous text
      (package private) static java.lang.String OPT_DET
      Constant for the classify option to add some text as a category
      (package private) static java.lang.String OPT_SAFE
      Constant for the classify option ADD to have text be added as safe text.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
        Constant for the determine class of text option in the CLASSIFY command.

      • parseGeoCommand

        public static float[] parseGeoCommand(java.lang.String command)
        If the command string is of the form LON XXX.XXXX LAT XXX.XXXX then this function will remove the longitude and latitude from the string and return them in a float array. The returning array will have longitude first in the array, and latitude second.
        Parameters:
        command - The String command to be parsed for geo commands
        Returns:
        A float array of size 2 with longitude and latitude stored in 0 and 1 indices. Note that if the command being parsed is not in the Geo command format then one or more of the resulting elements will be null. This should be checked by the calling program.

      • parseClassifyCommand

        public static java.lang.String parseClassifyCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Parses a classifying command and returns the text to be classified. Returns an empty string upon failing to read the text
        Parameters:
        command - The command to be parsed as a clasifier command.
        Returns:
        Returns the text to be classified on success or an empty string on failure.

      • parseTrainCommand

        public static java.lang.String[] parseTrainCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Parse a training comand into the form of CLASS TEXT... and returns it in a string array with the class in the first element and the text in the other. If the class or text is invalid both elements will be empty strings.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to be parsed as a training command
        Returns:
        A 2 element array with class of the text in the first element and the text in the second. If invalid elements
